answers.author: Mark Abeles-Allison
answers.text:
We are going through the same issues Jeff.  We do have a mental health facility that is not secure, that we sometimes take people too.  This is much less costly but is not always suitable.  You may want to see if there are alternatives to the hospital's secure, behavioral health facility.

answers.author: Thomas Wieczorek
answers.text:
I am familiar with a process that was created in Ionia County, Michigan which partnered Ionia County Community Mental Health with the Ionia County Sheriff's Department. Prisoners go through a screening process and intervention can be provided immediately or through a prescribed process. I believe the program was recently recognized by the State of Michigan as one of the most effective. More can be read here: http://www.capps-mi.org/material%20to%20put%20up/When%20jails%20must%20be%20mental%20health%20clinics.htm
You could also contact the Ionia County Undersheriff, Dale Miller, at 616-527-5737

author: Jeffrey French
text:
Does anyone have information on a process or check-off protocol for the delivery of mental health services to County jail inmates?  Specifically, we are facing an increasing number of emergency detentions, i.e. prisoners threatening to do harm to themselves of someon else.  The result is we are required to transport and house these inmates in a secure dention, (secure hospital setting).  
My question is does anyone have an effective protocol or mechanism to address these issues without having to incur the additional costs of a secure mental health facility?
Thank you and any information you can provide is apprecaited.
title: Mental Health Services for County Jail Inmates
